intro: Rutidea dupuisii, commonly known as the Peruvian velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, Rutidea dupuisii is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
